data.title: Today at the 2024 Paris Olympics: How to watch, U.S. men’s basketball, track and field
data.meta_description: Below you’ll find streaming/broadcast info, a schedule of events for Aug. 8 when Texans are competing and links to our coverage.
data.text:
In yesterday’s action, the U.S. added more medals to their tally on the track with a gold medal from Quincy Hall in the men’s 400m final and a silver medal in the men’s steeplechase final for Kenneth Rooks.

Tomorrow, the U.S. women will take on Australia in the semifinals of Olympic basketball. Meanwhile, TCU’s Hailey Van Lith and the U.S. women’s 3x3 basketball team took bronze.

Below you’ll find streaming/broadcast info, a schedule of events for today, when Texans are competing and links to our coverage.

Related:Now an Olympic long jump finalist, Jasmine Moore sets sights on next historic quest

How to watch the 2024 Paris Olympics

When: July 24-August 11

Where: Paris, France

TV channels: NBC, USA Network, E!, CNBC, Golf Channel

Streaming: Every event will be streamed on Peacock.

What’s on TV today?

BASKETBALL— 10:30 a.m.: (USA) Men’s semifinal; 1:45 p.m.: (USA) Men’s semifinal; 2 p.m.: (Universo) Baloncesto; 10:30 p.m.: (USA) Men’s semifinal

BEACH VOLLEYBALL— 10 a.m.: (E!) semifinal; 10 p.m.: (Ch. 5) Men’s semifinal; (Universo) Voleibol; 2 p.m.: (E!) semifinal; 3 p.m.: (Ch. 5) Men’s semifinal; 10 p.m.: (Ch. 5) Primetime in Paris (Aug. 8)*

BOXING— 9 a.m.: (USA) Men’s Middle, Light finals & more; 12:15 p.m.: (Telemundo) Medalla de Oro Boxeo

CANOEING— 6 a.m.: (E!) Sprint: Canoe, Kayak Semi, finals

CYCLING— 1:35 a.m.: (Ch. 5) NBC Late Night (Aug. 7)

DIVING— 3 a.m.: (E!) Women’s 3m Springboard semifinal; 8 a.m.: (E!) Men’s 3m Springboard final; 9 a.m.: (Telemundo) Clavados; 10 p.m.: (Ch. 5) Men’s semifinal; Noon: (Ch. 5) Women’s 3m Springboard semifinal; 10 p.m.: (Ch. 5) Primetime in Paris (Aug. 8)*

FIELD HOCKEY— 4 p.m.: (E!) Field Hockey, Women’s Kite final; 8:30 p.m.: (USA) Men’s gold final

GOLF— 2 a.m.: (Golf) Women’s Round 2: Part 1; 6 a.m.: (Golf) Women’s Round 2: Part 2

HANDBALL— 3 p.m.: (E!) Women’s semifinal

RHYTHMIC GYMNASTICS— 7 a.m.: (E!) Individual All-Around qualification; 10 p.m.: (E!) Individual All-Around: qualification

SAILING—4 p.m.: (E!) Field Hockey, Women’s Kite final

SOCCER— 9:45 a.m.: (Telemundo) Paris 2024 - Fútbol Masculino Medalla de Bronze

SPORT CLIMBING— 1:35 a.m.: (Ch. 5) NBC Late Night (Aug. 7); 4:45 a.m.: (E!) Men’s Speed, Women’s Combined

SWIMMING— 12:30 a.m.: (USA) Women’s 10km Open Water; 5 a.m.: (Telemundo) Natación y Atletismo

TABLE TENNIS— 2:35 a.m.: (USA) M&W Team: quarterfinals; 6 a.m.: (USA) Men’s Team: semifinals

TAEKWONDO— 9:30 a.m.: (USA) W 49kg, M 58kg Bronze/gold finals

TRACK & FIELD— 3 a.m.: (USA) Heats: Men’s & Women’s 4x100m & more; 5 a.m.: (Telemundo) Natación y Atletismo; 12:35 p.m.: (Ch. 5) finals: Men’s 200m & more; 1 p.m.: (Universo) Atletismo; 10 p.m.: (Ch. 5) Primetime in Paris (Aug. 8)*

VOLLEYBALL— 5 p.m.: (USA) Women’s semifinal; 7 p.m.: (USA) Women’s semifinal

WATER POLO— 7:30 a.m.: (USA) Water Polo, Weightlifting; 12:30 p.m.: (USA) Women’s semifinal; 4 p.m.: (Ch. 5) Women’s semifinal; 9:30 p.m.: (USA) Women’s semifinal

WEIGHTLIFTING— 7:30 a.m.: (USA) Water Polo, Weightlifting

WRESTLING— 10 a.m.: (USA) M 57kg, W 57kg Freestyle Eliminations; 4 p.m.: (USA) finals: GR 67kg, W Freestyle 53kg & more

* — indicates a rerun

Which Texans compete today?

Jasmine Moore

A Mansfield Lake Ridge product, Moore already made history before she even stepped on the track at these Olympics. She became the first U.S. woman to qualify for both the triple and long jump at the Olympics. Moore won a bronze medal in the triple jump and the women’s long jump final today at 1:00 p.m.

Tara Davis-Woodhall

The former Texas Longhorn is looking to bring back an Olympic medal in the women’s long jump final today at 1:00 p.m. Davis-Woodhall, who is the collegiate record holder in the long jump, placed sixth at the Tokyo Olympics and just last summer at the world championships won a silver medal.

Kevin Durant

The former University of Texas standout and NBA champion will be a part of a U.S. basketball squad that takes on Serbia in the Olympic men’s basketball semifinal today at 2:00 p.m.

Medal count

Upcoming events

Track and field continues until August 11.

The men’s basketball final is on Aug. 10, and the women’s championship is the following day. The gold medal match for men’s soccer is on Aug. 9 at Parc des Princes, and the women hold their final at the same venue the next day.

When will Sha’Carri Richardson run?

The Dallas native ran in the women’s 100m finals where she placed second to Saint Lucia’s Julien Alfred.

If Richardson is selected for the U.S. 4x100 meter relay, preliminary rounds will be today at 4:10 a.m., and the final will be tomorrow at 12:30 p.m.

Related:From Carter to global stardom: A timeline of Dallas native Sha’Carri Richardson’s rise

Other Texans competing and when

Bryce Hoppel

The Midland, Texas native will be competing in the men’s 800m. Hoppel advanced out of his preliminary heat yesterday and into the semifinal that takes place on Friday at 4:30 a.m. If he qualifies for the final, it is scheduled for Saturday Aug. 10 at 12:05 p.m.

Brittney Griner

A Baylor grad from Houston originally, Griner is a key piece in the U.S. women’s basketball team. Griner had 11 points in their latest win over Nigeria. The U.S. will play Australia at 10:30 a.m. on Friday in the semifinals.
